image.altText: a man standing at a bank of microphones

props.synopsis: Days out from the Queensland government's state budget, the opposition leader has pledged to honour funding commitments if he wins office.

title.children: Has Queensland LNP leader's small-target election strategy become a big distraction?

image.altText: Jane and John Newson, in their 70s, smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Jane Newson saves for a P&O cruise every year and says it's her chance to see the world when other options are too expensive. The cruise company's surprise exit from Australia after 90 years is the end of an era for her and the national icon.

title.children: P&O exiting Australia is the end of a cruising era — and 'mega ships' could be to blame

image.altText: A group of forensics police officers wearing blue overalls outside a home on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: A damning report identified more than 170 breaches of the NSW Police Force's own domestic violence procedures, with officers failing to do the basics like seizing guns, taking a statement, or checking CCTV footage.

title.children: Failed to seize guns, grant protection orders or take statements: The DV failures of one police force reflect another

image.altText: Weeds growing out of the putting greens at the former Arundel Hills Country club

props.synopsis: Queensland's Planning Minister says she will intervene in a controversial development as part of plans to build a million homes in the next 20 years.

title.children: Minister plans to intervene on defunct golf course development to encourage affordable housing

image.altText: Composite of Ben Hunt, Tom Dearden and Joseph Sua'ali'i

props.synopsis: The Maroons claim bragging rights after defeating the Blues 38-10 in the State of Origin opener, but their win didn't come without a spot of controversy. Here are five quick hits from State of Origin I in Sydney.

title.children: Five quick hits — Sua'ali'i cops month-long ban as Hunt stands tall for Maroons in Origin I

image.altText: Australian passport

props.synopsis: Immigration is a hot issue in the UK and US election campaigns as arrivals surge and voters face cost-of-living pressure. But reducing migrant numbers has economic consequences too.

title.children: At the height of hand-wringing over the economic impacts of immigration, nobody bothered to ask the Reserve Bank

image.altText: A wombat

props.synopsis: The success of conserving and breeding one of the world's most endangered animals, the northern hairy-nosed wombat, has seen the species move to a third location for the first time in decades.

title.children: Back from the brink, hairy-nosed wombats settle into ready-made new home

image.altText: GettyImages-2155608517

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur's stunning French Open run ends in straight sets at the hands of German Alexander Zverev at Roland Garros. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: De Minaur's French Open run falls at the hands of German star

image.altText: Selwyn Cobbo high-fives Queensland Maroons teammate Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow during State of Origin I.

props.synopsis: Naming Selwyn Cobbo on the bench for State of Origin I could have been disastrous for Billy Slater and Queensland, but it ultimately paid off in the most predictable way imaginable.

title.children: 'Hindsight's a great thing': Slater's big bench gamble proves to not be a gamble at all in Origin I

image.altText: Two men look despondent after losing a State of Origin match

props.synopsis: Recovering from Joseph Sua'ali'i's early send-off was always going to be an impossible mission for New South Wales, and while the Blues fought to the end, the greater fallout of the tackle that rocked Origin may be yet to come.

title.children: The Blues suffered a fatal wound after eight minutes of Origin I but took plenty of time to die

image.altText: A woman surrounded by cameras, crying.

props.synopsis: The Italian court found Knox wrongly accused an innocent man, the Congolese owner of the bar where she worked, of the 2007 killing.

title.children: Amanda Knox re-convicted in Italian slander case after prior exoneration for 2007 murder of roommate

image.altText: King Charles holds and hand to his eye as he tears up

props.synopsis: The 75-year-old monarch, who recently resumed public engagements, is expected to meet with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and US President Joe Biden in France for the World War II anniversary.

title.children: King Charles heads D-Day's 80th anniversary commemorations before first international trip since cancer diagnosis

image.altText: A woman in a pink top smiles sadly while looking away slightly, in front of photo wall.

props.synopsis: Naomi Bowden's tear-stained face brought a state inquiry into birth trauma to global attention, but she and other women say the inquiry's final report does not go far enough.

title.children: A 'me too' moment for birth is happening in NSW, but the women who helped propel it want to see it go further

image.altText: The entrance to Cranbrook School

props.synopsis: The elite Sydney private school missed two deadlines for answering questions from a parliamentary committee following an ABC investigation into allegations of a toxic culture, workplace bullying and abuse.

title.children: 'A serious matter': Private school Cranbrook criticised for lack of cooperation in federal investigation

image.altText: Rain forecast over four days on map of NSW

props.synopsis: Up to 250 millimetres of rain could soak parts of south-east NSW during the next 24 hours as another major rain event unfolds across the state.

title.children: Bureau issues flood watch from Sydney to South Coast as deluge returns

image.altText: A white van carrying Armaguard's badge logo stationary in a parking lot.

props.synopsis: Armaguard is facing a new investigation by the competition watchdog, as it comes under intense scrutiny over its troubled monopoly on cash transportation around the country.

title.children: Cash crisis gets messy, with fresh ACCC scrutiny of troubled Armaguard

image.altText: Woman looks at the NDIS complaints form online

props.synopsis: The federal government is committing to work further with the disability community to design changes to the National Disability Insurance Scheme.

title.children: How will people with disability be involved in designing changes to the NDIS?

image.altText: Front on view of an icebreaker ship.

props.synopsis: Newly released documents show the Australian Antarctic Division issued a stern rebuke to Serco, the private operator of the RSV Nuyina, for failing to comply with strict COVID vaccination rules on a voyage to Antarctica, where an infection could have severe consequences.

title.children: 'Disappointing to see': Antarctic Division frustrated as icebreaker crew fail to get COVID jabs

image.altText: Colourful graphic of a girl pictured from behind wearing headphones, with game controllers, coins and stars around her.

props.synopsis: Researchers believe about 100,000 Australian teenagers are clinically addicted to video games, amid concern game companies are using tactics that make it harder for people to play in moderation.

title.children: Young gamers 'collapse', suffer 'medical episodes' as psychiatrist warns of addictive product design

image.altText: A teenager looks down at a smartphone screen displaying the Snapchat logo, a yellow screen with a white ghost cartoon

props.synopsis: Perth mum Rhiannon shares why she and her husband opted to offer a financial incentive to their three kids to encourage them to stay off social media until they've finished school.

title.children: We offered our kids $5,000 to stay off social media. Here's how it's going

image.altText: An image of a man holding a long black object walking past a bush on a suburban street

props.synopsis: The 57-year-old has pleaded not guilty to the alleged murders of Carol Clay and Russell Hill and will give evidence on Thursday.

title.children: Greg Lynn, accused of murdering two campers, will take the stand in Supreme Court trial

image.altText: A couple at home in a bath in their home having a baby.

props.synopsis: Thea and Kaitlyn are among a growing number of people in the Northern Territory casting aside traditional hospital births and staying home instead, as part of the country's longest-running publicly funded homebirth program.

title.children: It's not an option for everybody, but more and more people are giving birth to their babies at home

image.altText: A wide view of the front of an old, dilapidated cottage covered in weeds and overgrowth

props.synopsis: When Kirsty and Mark decided to rescue and restore this 170-year-old cottage, they knew there'd be some unexpected challenges. But first they had to reclaim it from the blackberries and weeds "holding it together".

title.children: How this colonial cottage was saved from ruin

image.altText: A rocket is launched to space in a big cloud of smoke from a location with palm trees and blue skies

props.synopsis: A pair of NASA test pilots blasted off aboard Boeing's Starliner capsule for the International Space Station, belatedly joining SpaceX as a second taxi service for the US space agency.

title.children: Boeing launches NASA astronauts to space aboard its Starliner capsule after years of delays

image.altText: Women in a rally against domestic violence.

props.synopsis: Nine WA women have been killed in violent acts this year, with three of those deaths occurring in the past fortnight. What is behind WA's alarmingly high rate of gendered violence?

title.children: WA's domestic violence scourge in numbers: Women murdered in the west at double the rate of NSW

image.altText: albo bandt dutton

props.synopsis: The government and the opposition have joined together in parliament to condemn Greens members' involvement in pro-Palestinian protests, accusing the party of inflaming tensions over social cohesion.

title.children: 'I will not be lectured about peace and non-violence': Bipartisan condemnation of Greens' involvement in pro-Palestinian protests

image.altText: A man in his-vis gear walks past an ASX share price board.

props.synopsis: Australian shares are set to rise as Wall Street rose overnight and the Bank of Canada's decision to cut rates by 25 basis points for the first time since March 2020 increases hopes for the European Central Bank to follow.

title.children: Australian shares to follow Wall Street gains, Nvidia joins $3 trillion club

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Bank of Canada's rate cut paves the way for more
Nvidia value surges past $3 trillion and overtakes Apple

image.altText: A middle aged woman with a light brown bob and glasses speaks in front of small microphones mounted on a desk.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank of Australia's governor says the federal government's proposed $300 energy bill relief will not have a "material" impact on reducing inflation, but is also unlikely to make inflation worse.

title.children: RBA governor says $300 energy bill relief is unlikely to impact inflation

image.altText: tinned peaches on a supermarket shelf

props.synopsis: One of Australia’s largest food processors says it has reacted to shoppers buying cheaper imported food amid the cost-of-living crisis.

title.children: Fruit growers urge shoppers to buy local after major processor SPC cuts canned fruit production

image.altText: Two swans in a lake

props.synopsis: A nearly two-decade study of birds living in Melbourne's Albert Park has revealed surprising relationship patterns between black swans.

title.children: The secret to a successful long-term monogamous relationship could involve taking month long breaks — according to swans

image.altText: A train arrives at a modern station with people waiting to get on

props.synopsis: Future extensions and upgrades to Adelaide's rail network will be investigated under funding allocated in South Australia's budget, while more beds have been pledged for two of the city's hospitals.

title.children: Adelaide rail extensions to be investigated with new funding in South Australia's budget

image.altText: Waves crash onto Bar Beach, Newcastle.

props.synopsis: With Australian households spending an increasingly large chunk of their incomes on housing, it's no wonder some of us are looking for more affordable alternatives.

title.children: Australians leaving the big smoke for cities like Newcastle and Geelong, and it's actually a 'pretty smart move'
